Parameters: int: index where the composing text starts.

reset().Description: Resets the internal state so that this instance can be reused to build another instance of @B_android#view#inputmethod#CursorAnchorInfo_E@.

Parameters: Matrix: transformation matrix from local coordinates into screen coordinates. null is interpreted as an identity matrix.
setMatrix(android.graphics.Matrix).Description: Sets the matrix that transforms local coordinates into screen coordinates.

Parameters: float: horizontal position of the insertion marker, in the local coordinates that will be transformed with the transformation matrix when rendered on the screen. This should be calculated or compatible with @B_android#text#Layout#getPrimaryHorizontal_E@.

float: vertical position of the insertion marker, in the local coordinates that will be transformed with the transformation matrix when rendered on the screen. This should be calculated or compatible with @B_android#text#Layout#getLineTop_E@.

float: vertical position of the insertion marker, in the local coordinates that will be transformed with the transformation matrix when rendered on the screen. This should be calculated or compatible with @B_android#text#Layout#getLineBaseline_E@.

float: vertical position of the insertion marker, in the local coordinates that will be transformed with the transformation matrix when rendered on the screen. This should be calculated or compatible with @B_android#text#Layout#getLineBottom_E@.
int: flags of the insertion marker. See @B_android#view#inputmethod#CursorAnchorInfo#FLAG_HAS_VISIBLE_REGION_E@ for example.
setInsertionMarkerLocation(float,float,f.Description: Sets the location of the text insertion point (zero width cursor) as a rectangle in local coordinates. Calling this can be skipped when there is no text insertion point; however if there is an insertion point, editors must call this method.
setInsertionMarkerLocation(float,float,f.FullName: public CursorAnchorInfo.Builder setInsertionMarkerLocation (float horizontalPosition, float lineTop, float lineBaseline, float lineBottom, int flags)

Throws: if one or more positional parameters are specified but the coordinate transformation matrix is not provided via @B_android#view#inputmethod#CursorAnchorInfo#Builder#setMatrix_E@.

Parameters: int: index of the character in Java chars units. Must be specified in ascending order across successive calls.
float: x coordinate of the left edge of the character in local coordinates.
float: y coordinate of the top edge of the character in local coordinates.
float: x coordinate of the right edge of the character in local coordinates.
float: y coordinate of the bottom edge of the character in local coordinates.

int: flags for this character bounds. See @B_android#view#inputmethod#CursorAnchorInfo#FLAG_HAS_VISIBLE_REGION_E@, @B_android#view#inputmethod#CursorAnchorInfo#FLAG_HAS_INVISIBLE_REGION_E@ and @B_android#view#inputmethod#CursorAnchorInfo#FLAG_IS_RTL_E@. These flags must be specified when necessary.
Throws: If the index is a negative value, or not greater than all of the previously called indices.
addCharacterBounds(int,float,float,float.Description: Adds the bounding box of the character specified with the index.
addCharacterBounds(int,float,float,float.FullName: public CursorAnchorInfo.Builder addCharacterBounds (int index, float left, float top, float right, float bottom, int flags)

ClassDesc: Builder for @B_android#view#inputmethod#CursorAnchorInfo_E@. This class is not designed to be thread-safe.
